docs.snippet: The St. Louis Cardinals said they factored in the free agent Jhonny Peralta’s drug suspension when they negotiated his four-year contract worth about $53 million....

docs.abstract: St Louis Cardinals say they factored in the free agent Jhonny Peralta’s drug suspension when they negotiated his four-year contract worth about $53 million.

docs.snippet: The Mets’ inclusion of Lucas Duda in their holiday e-card, as well as their pass on a deal with shortstop Jhonny Peralta, might signal how much the team is willing to spend in the free-agent market....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets’ inclusion of Lucas Duda in their holiday e-card, as well as their pass on a deal with shortstop Jhonny Peralta, might signal how much the team is willing to spend in the free-agent market.

headline.main: Mets Send Holiday Cheer, and Mixed Messages
headline.print_headline: Mets Send Holiday Cheer, and Mixed Messages

docs.snippet: The 488 acres of Great Kills Park was the depository for 15 million cubic yards of fill in the 1940s and 1950s, including medical and sanitary waste....
docs.lead_paragraph: The 488 acres of Great Kills Park was the depository for 15 million cubic yards of fill in the 1940s and 1950s, including medical and sanitary waste.
docs.abstract: National Park Service acknowledges contamination at Great Kills Park on Staten Island is more extensive than originally believed; 488-acre park was depository for 15 million cubic yards of fill in the 1940s and 1950s, including medical and sanitary waste, some of which contained radium; more than half the park has shown some degree of radioactivity; lengthy process now begins to map contamination and devise a cleanup plan.

headline.main: Radiation Cleanup at Park on Staten Island to Take Years
headline.print_headline: Cleaning Up Radiation In Park May Take Years

docs.snippet: Louis Gritsipis, a Greek immigrant, didn’t just turn down an offer for his diner’s building in Manhattan; he ran away from the conference....
docs.lead_paragraph: Louis Gritsipis, a Greek immigrant, didn’t just turn down an offer for his diner’s building in Manhattan; he ran away from the conference.
docs.abstract: The Appraisal column; Greek immigrant Louis Gritsipis did not just turn down an offer for his diner’s building in Manhattan, he fled the negotiations with JD Carlisle Development Corp; modest property at 647 West 42nd Street remains as a monument to family, if not obstinacy.

headline.main: American Dreamer on 42nd Street Who Fled From a Deal
headline.print_headline: This American Dreamer Fled From a Multimillion-Dollar Deal
